data.title: Rhyne's President to Retire at End of 24
data.meta_description: Lenoir-Rhyne University’s 12th President, Dr. Fred Whitt, has announced that he plans to retire at the of the 2024-25 academic year, marking the end of a 50 yea
data.text:
Lenoir-Rhyne University’s 12th President, Dr. Fred Whitt, has announced that he plans to retire at the of the 2024-25 academic year, marking the end of a 50 year career in higher education. Dr. Whitt assumed the presidency at L-R on February 1, 2017.

During Dr. Whitt’s tenure, the university emphasized four themes identified in its strategic plan—enhancing academic excellence, improving the student experience, boosting brand identity, and ensuring a sustainable future.

A nationwide search for Dr. Whitt’s successor will begin in the coming months. Until then, Dr. Whitt will remain fully committed to Lenoir-Rhyne through the 2024-25 academic year and will work to ensure a smooth transition for the next president.

Contributing to his decision to retire, Dr. Whitt cited a desire to travel and spend more time with his extended family, including his five grandchildren (ages one through nine).
